{"step_by_step_thinking": "Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma is a type of cancer that originates in the lymphatic system, the body's disease-fighting network. The most common type of Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma is B-cell lymphoma, which makes up about 85% of Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma in the United States. This includes the orbit, which is the bony cavity that contains the eyeball.", "answer_choice": "A. B-cell"}
